channel.title: Setting up port forwarding with usage of no-ip
channel.description:
Dont know if I'm asking the right question but heres what ive done thus far. 1 Got my game setup 2 Created a no-ipaccount and host 3 setup router to allow portforwarding on 43594 to computer hosting game 4 Allowed windows firewall to allow connections from TCP/UDP port 43594 Now heres the problem: Users from outside cannot connect to the game.
Everyone within my subnet can connect fine and tested on many computers Its just when I try to get someone from outside of my network to join it will not allow them.
What am I doing wrong or have forgotten?
If I have posted this in the wrong place please le me know because this is my first posting here.
*EDIT*
I figured out what I didnt do. I realized that I had to port-forward port 80 also to my server. Not sure if it was the correct method of doing it but it now works and I'm happy with it.
Ports-forwarded: 2 80, 43594
***Now to create an Apache Web server to host the client and source. ***I'll update more on that later.

item.title: Setting up port forwarding with usage of no-ip
item.dc:creator: @honakerd honakerd
item.description:
@honakerd wrote:

Dont know if I’m asking the right question but heres what ive done thus far.
1 Got my game setup
2 Created a no-ipaccount and host
3 setup router to allow portforwarding on 43594 to computer hosting game
4 Allowed windows firewall to allow connections from TCP/UDP port 43594
Now heres the problem: Users from outside cannot connect to the game.

Everyone within my subnet can connect fine and tested on many computers
Its just when I try to get someone from outside of my network to join it will not allow them.

What am I doing wrong or have forgotten?

If I have posted this in the wrong place please le me know because this is my first posting here.

EDIT

I figured out what I didnt do. I realized that I had to port-forward port 80 also to my server. Not sure if it was the correct method of doing it but it now works and I’m happy with it.

Ports-forwarded: 2
80, 43594

***Now to create an Apache Web server to host the client and source.
***I’ll update more on that later.
